skill.name: torch-geometric
skill.description: Graph Neural Networks (PyG). Node/graph classification, link prediction, GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, heterogeneous graphs, molecular property prediction, for geometric deep learning.
skill.summary: Graph Neural Networks (PyG). Node/graph classification, link prediction, GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, hetero...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains documentation and utility Python scripts for PyTorch Geometric. The scripts perform model benchmarking, visualization, and template generation without credential access, environment harvesting, or suspicious network patterns. Dataset downloads use standard PyG APIs to public benchmarks only.

content.user_title: Build GNN workflows with PyTorch Geometric
content.value_statement: You need clear templates and references for graph learning tasks. This skill provides PyG model templates, benchmarks, and visualization helpers for node classification, graph classification, and molecular prediction.
actual_capabilities: Generate node classification templates for GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE architectures
Generate graph classification templates for GIN model
Benchmark GNN models on Planetoid or TUDataset benchmarks
Visualize graph structure with node colors, layouts, and labels
Plot degree distributions and graph statistics summaries
Access reference documentation for 40+ GNN layers and transforms
limitations: Requires torch_geometric and dependencies to be installed
Downloads datasets to /tmp at runtime when using example scripts
Supports only predefined model templates (GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE, GIN)
No automated hyperparameter search or experiment tracking

use_cases.title: Benchmark GNN baselines
use_cases.description: Compare GCN, GAT, and GraphSAGE accuracy and training time on citation networks.

use_cases.title: Start a graph project
use_cases.description: Generate a ready-to-run template for node or graph classification tasks.

use_cases.title: Teach graph concepts
use_cases.description: Visualize graph structure and degree distributions for classroom demonstrations.

prompt_templates.title: Create GCN starter
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a GCN node classification template and show steps to run it on Cora.

prompt_templates.title: Run benchmark
prompt_templates.prompt: Benchmark GCN and GAT on CiteSeer for 100 epochs and summarize expected outputs.

prompt_templates.title: Visualize dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to visualize the Cora graph with node colors by label and save to PNG.

prompt_templates.title: Plan GIN run
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GIN graph classification template and explain how to split ENZYMES into train and test sets.

output_examples.input: Create a GCN node classification template for Cora and explain how to run it.
output: GCN template generated for Cora node classification
Installation steps for PyG and required dependencies listed
Training loop with train/val/test masks described
Expected output format for accuracy metrics

best_practices: Start with small datasets like Cora before scaling to large graphs
Set random seeds when comparing benchmark results across runs
Use validation accuracy to select best model checkpoints
anti_patterns: Running benchmarks on large datasets without setting epoch limits
Assuming templates include custom data preprocessing logic
Visualizing full graphs without using max_nodes parameter

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Follow PyTorch Geometric compatibility. Use Python 3.8-3.11 with PyG-recommended PyTorch version.

faq.question: What model types are included?
faq.answer: Templates include GCN, GAT, GraphSAGE for node classification and GIN for graph classification tasks.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my training pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, adapt the generated templates and benchmarking code into existing training scripts.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No, code reads only public benchmark datasets and does not send data externally.

faq.question: What if dataset loading fails?
faq.answer: Verify dataset names match PyG documentation, check PyG installation, and ensure internet access.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full MLOps stack?
faq.answer: This provides templates and scripts. No experiment tracking, deployment, or automated hyperparameter tuning.
